content.step1: Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C). Grease two 8-inch round cake pans and line the bottoms with parchment paper for an 8-serving chocolate cake.
content.step2: Whisk 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour, 1 cup granulated sugar, 2 teaspoons baking powder, and 1/2 teaspoon salt in a large bowl for dry ingredients.
content.step3: In another bowl, combine 1/2 cup unsweetened cocoa powder and 1 cup whole milk, whisking until smooth to create the chocolate mixture.
content.step4: Add 2 large eggs and 1 teaspoon vanilla extract to the chocolate mixture, whisking until well combined for a smooth batter.
content.step5: Pour the batter into prepared pans and bake for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
content.step6: Let the cakes cool in pans for 5 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely before frosting with your favorite chocolate frosting.
